name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On June 4, the official account of the Political and Legal Affairs Commission, "Youliyoumianer", used the term "human mine" to describe India.
This is the first time that the official has used this term since the relevant content of the civil discussion about "human mine" was cleared in January this year.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
The "pointing at a mouse and calling it a duck" incident continues to ferment
The screenshots circulated online show that the director of the school's new media center asked students to control online comments to protect the school.
However, some netizens discovered that the school had a "mouse head" incident in 2008.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On June 5, at Jinhui Primary School in Chengdu Hi-tech Zone, a primary school student was hit by a basketball stand while watching his classmates play basketball because the basketball stand had been in disrepair for a long time. He died.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Recently, a Chinese man who claimed to have joined the "Wagner" mercenary army became popular on the Internet. In his Kuaishou account, he not only shared his experience of joining the Russian army, but also made some personal comments and opinions. On June 6, the man released a video again, warning the United States and NATO to stop their hegemonic behavior, otherwise they would be eliminated.
The account was subsequently banned by Kuaishou.
According to Weibo netizens, the man is from Xiaoyi, Shanxi, named Wu Min, born in the 1990s, has military experience, failed in anti-corruption online, and sneaked into Russia to fight and make money to fight against the US imperialism.
Some netizens also questioned that he might have just participated in the Russian "military summer camp".

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On the evening of June 6, Hong Kong.
At the fan meeting of Thai artist BILLKIN & PP KRIT (BKPP), fans questioned the host's use of the terms "China", "Hong Kong" and "Taiwan" in parallel, and shouted "ONE CHINA" and "CHINA CHINA CHINA" in unison.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
@Fight_forALL Thank you for the verification. Since the contributor is a teacher at Southwest University and has been contributing news related to Southwest University since the outbreak, we did not do much verification this time.
We are also further verifying with the contributor, and will publicly apologize if there is any false content.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Recently, a video titled "Foreigners are gone! Rents on Fuxing Middle Road in Shanghai have plummeted!" was played 15 million times on the Internet.
In the video, the anchor said that foreign workers in Shanghai are leaving in large numbers.
Originally, all the high-priced rental houses near Fuxing Middle Road were empty because "all the foreigners from Fortune 500 companies in Shanghai have left."
A day later, the anchor posted a video saying that he was worried about the bad impact on the public and took it down.
"Life always has ups and downs, and the economy always has cycles. It doesn't mean that we can't survive without foreigners."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On June 7, this year's college entrance examination was suspected to have leaked questions again
In a group called "College Entrance Examination Mathematics and High School Mathematics", a netizen posted a photo of the leaked questions of this year's "Mathematics·New College Entrance Examination Paper 1".
Afterwards, in the Fudan University student group, a netizen said that during the afternoon math exam, someone asked him to tutor the questions in the picture.
